solution_line_template: Dabbie paid {weight_first_turkey} x ${cost_per_kg} = $<<{weight_first_turkey}*{cost_per_kg}={cost_first_turkey}>>{cost_first_turkey} for the first turkey.
He paid {weight_second_turkey} x $ {cost_per_kg}= $<<{weight_second_turkey}*{cost_per_kg}={cost_second_turkey}>>{cost_second_turkey} for the second turkey.
And the weight of the third turkey is {weight_second_turkey} x {multiplier_third_turkey} = <<{weight_second_turkey}*{multiplier_third_turkey}={weight_third_turkey}>>{weight_third_turkey} kilograms.
So, the price of the third turkey is {weight_third_turkey} x ${cost_per_kg} = $<<{weight_third_turkey}*{cost_per_kg}={cost_third_turkey}>>{cost_third_turkey}.

Therefore, the total amount he paid for all the turkeys is ${cost_first_turkey} + ${cost_second_turkey} + ${cost_third_turkey} = $<<{cost_first_turkey}+{cost_second_turkey}+{cost_third_turkey}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}.
